dict.string: Welcome to the Indian Residential School History and Dialogue Centre. We welcome your feedback on this space. If you have any questions or comments, please reach out to a staff member.

Throughout the entire installation, colours are consistent. Blue items indicate residential schools. pink items indicate events, green items indicate organizations and purple items indicate artifacts.
Tapping a pin, dragging the timeline, or pinching the map are great ways to get started exploring the installation.
When you begin moving the map, the timeline, or interacting with the nodes, the installation will automatically create an individual session for you.

If you are working alone with the installation, the aeshtetic layer may move across all screens. As more people begin using the installation it will continuously divide down into a maximum of six individual sessions.
You can move around the map, or the timeline, by touching and dragging a finger across the screen. On the node visualizer, you can drag elements around.

Tap a pin on the map, a flag on the timeline, or a element on the node visualizer to select. In the timeline and map layers this will open a record, on the node visualizer this will put focus on that node.
To zoom in to or out of the map you can pinch with two fingers. The timeline and node visualizer do not have the ability to zoom.
